item.title: America’s missing Iran strategy
item.description: The airstrikes didn’t completely destroy the nuclear program. They only bought time.

item.description: Trump’s demand to investigate Democrats is political malpractice.

item.description: The South Carolina congresswoman is not ready to be the state’s governor.

item.description: Readers make cases for New York City, Alaska and Belize.

item.description: Readers make the case for midcentury toasters — and against classic cars.

item.title: The path to peace in Gaza comes to a crossroads at the U.N.
item.description: To end the misery in Gaza, the U.N. Security Council should embrace President Trump’s peace plan.

item.title: All the things your 50-year mortgage will outlast
item.description: Four pets. Two marriages. Several thousand hair follicles.

item.title: A South Korean warning for America on free speech
item.description: Let “disinformation” be tackled through free and fiery speech in pursuit of the truth.

item.title: Dulles people movers cannot go away fast enough
item.description: The airport authority hopes to keep them in service for another 15 to 20 years.

item.title: A great nation is reduced to fanciful hoping
item.description: America used to borrow for emergencies. Now it is mired in a perpetual debt emergency.

item.title: Why Democrats keep flailing
item.description: Voters aren’t rejecting government. They are rejecting leaders who can’t run it effectively.

item.title: I’m an academic who found religion. Cue the incredulous reactions.
item.description: In university and policy settings, religious belief is often derided. I sought spiritual nourishment.

item.title: Why this Nobel Prize winner is backing Trump’s Venezuela strategy
item.description: María Corina Machado wants to cut cash flows to Venezuelan dictator Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Modernize the FAA
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on post-shutdown flight delays.
